Title.evidence: A Double-Blind Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Minimally Invasive and Classic Approaches in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the MIS or CLASS group using a block-randomised, stratified method

Participants.evidence: enrolling 120 patients eligible for primary noncemented THA between January 2005 and November 2007

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to either the MIS or CLASS group

Objective.evidence: This study aims to evaluate whether MIS results in superior clinical outcomes compared to CLASS.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the Harris Hip Score (HHS) at 6 weeks postoperatively.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was maintained for patients and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 120 patients were randomised, with 60 in each group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was performed on an intention-to-treat basis.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included six complications in the MIS group and two in the CLASS group.
